11111.content:
It was shaping up to be yet another normal day for the busty, purple haired Tomo Yamanobe.

The sun was on it's way into the sky, and her lifelong best friend, Mafuyu, was passed out next to her. She didn't want to disturb her sleeping companion, but, her stomach had other plans, and it let those plans be known with a low, hungry growl. Tomo squeaks and looks over to her friends, who was awoken by tomos' gut.


"I-I'm sorry, Mafuyu!" She says, going red with embarassment. Mayfuyu giggles and gets up, poking Tomos' belly playfully. "Well, we should fix that." she says, getting out of bed.

They had their usual large, hearty breakfast before they started to get themselves prepared to head to their classes.

The day went on as per usual. Alexander says something that comes off as disrespectful or snarky, Hana and Miyuri pick on them, and so on and so forth.

However, this was the least of Miss Yamanobes' concerns. At only 10:45, just 2 and a half hours after they ate, her stomach starts growling again, as if she hadn't eaten breakfast at all.

She holds her rumbling belly, and turns to Mafuyu. "Um....Mafu?" she asks. "Can we go get lunch soon?" she asks. "Breakfast was 2 hours ago." Mafuyu replies. Before tomo can explain, her stomach lets out another angry growl, as if it was demanding food. "....Was your belly always that noisy?" The red headed kendo fighter asks. "I-I don't think so....." Tomo replies. It was pretty obvious she was getting a little concerned. "What should we do?" Mafuyu purses her lips, thinking of the best solution.

"We should go to the nurse, just to be sure." Mafuyu advises.

After going to visit Miss Urada Oikawa, and conducting a few tests, (Checking her pulse, listening for any odd bowel noises, breathing patterns, etc.) she comes up with, really a rather relaxing conclusion.

"It's quite simple. You're a growing girl, and your body needs more sustenance to keep up with it." Tomo and Mafuyu sigh in relief, glad it wasn't anything too serious. "But wait, how come I haven't had any sudden appetite spikes?" Oribe asks. "Well, tomo has a lot more boob to carry around, so it would make sense she just has to exert more energy by default." Mafuyu looks to tomo, why smiles her typical bashful grin, followed by a shrug. Then, another hungry growl from Tomos tummy, making her blush and clutch her belly. "Well, what're you two waiting for? Go on, get her something to snack on!" She orders. Mafuyu bows, thanks the nurse for her help, and they go off to find a vending machine.


After sufficiently sating her appetite, tomo had a noticeable little bulge in her belly. Mafuyu teases her and pokes her step-sisters stomach. "Congratulations!" Tomo blushes and playfully shoves Mafuyu. "Oh stop it."

Seeing that the issue was, for now, solved, the pair head back to class.

Nothing much outside the normal happens, but come lunch, tomos belly begins rumbling again.

"Well, it is lunch, and my tummy has been making some noises to." Mafuyu says, rubbing her flat, toned stomach. Tomo stands up and the two of them saunter out of the classroom.

Tomo then begins to load up her plate with almost every dish that's being served that day. Once they sit down, she wastes no time in stuffing her face. Soon, however, she realizes her friend is staring at her with a goof grin on her mug. "....What?" she asks. Mafu just giggles. "Someones hungry today." she says.

"Nurses orders." Tomo giggles. Lunch ends, and somehow all of the contents on the plate have been fit into Miss Yamanobes belly, which is now quite rounded and gurgling contentedly. "That'll hold me over until dinner." she says. Standing up, she stumbles a bit, not used to having this much food stuffed inside her, but she regains her composure, and heads off to class once the bell rings.

1213321.content:
An exasperated sigh rose from the plump lips of a volumptous tanned woman, her body draped across a small, makeshift throne of sorts as she gazed at the blue sky concealed by the canopy of the tropical forests above. Normally, a girl like her would be complaining of the stagnant humidity this forest presented to her, but with her wearing almost nothing, and essentially being undead at that, the Ancient Princess, Menace found no such annoyance plauging her supple and curvacious body. What was bugging her, however, was the current situation she was in, this one being the most unfavorable one yet. Currently, she had made a swift retreat from a battle that had all but gone south against those who were partaking in the tournament to gain the Queen's Blade. The egyptian sorceress had fought well with her army of undead soliders but, in the end, it proved fruitless and she was sent back, tail between her legs. While, she had been summoned by the Swamp Witch to stop the tournament, Menace wished to use this time to restore to her the kingdom that she lost thousands of years past to a mentor who stabbed her in the back all those years ago. Unfortunately, with things going as they are, it would take much longer for the princess' dreams to be realized.

In anycase, Menace had found herself a rather peaceful hide away within a remote location in the humid rain forests far from the battlefield. It was here that she had set up a small outpost where she and her remaining servants laid low while the princess' mind worked it's muscles hard to churn out a decent plan to rebound from this defeat and come back as strong as ever and maybe even get in some payback for the humiliation. In that time, Menace had taken up on eating whatever her mindless servants would give her, the princess using the food as a means to focus her concentration and think for only a moment. Of course, with having spent a couple days in this location with little action, the indulgance of these foods were steadily beginning to show on Menace's figure. Her already generous bosom had swollen up a size or two, the slowly fattening breasts pushing the golden breastplate up and apart as they began to make threats of breaking it's resolve. Her belly had rounded out a little, and love handles where beginning to make an shy appearance. Then came her lower extremeties which were wider and slowly plumping up, her bottom seeming to gain the most of it as her striped slowly began to wedge inbetwixt the crack of her juicy rear end.

Menace herself hadn't really noticed her gradual increase in mass, she believing that being undead excuses her from getting fat...which seemed to be proven false by the obvious happening. Her servants lacked the mental freedom to say anything of her weight, so they were ruled out. Which left only one more individual, or rather object, to place it's opinion...

"Ahhh, you certainly are getting wider, Menace." A lecherous, male voice rang out, the princess pausing in her munchings to gaze at the black scepter laying beside her. It was a living object, one she's carried with her and found great use in since she was the princess of the Amara Kingdom long ago. It's name being Setra, it proved to give good insight at times but also boasted...a lewd disposition beyond this. Menace often never paid attention to it's advances towards her, and, depending on the comment, often found it flattering. Not this time, though. "Hehe, If you keep this up, your already bulbous behind's is going to...swallow up your undergarments."

"What are you saying, Setra?" Menace chided, her lips curled down in a frown as she turned to gaze at her large rump as best she could seeing no change in it's usual dimensions. At least, no drastic ones anyway. "I'm not fat, well toned and curvy, yes. But fat, I am not."

"Ooh, denial will get you nowhere, my princess~" Setra chuckled, knowing what it spoke of was the almighty truth. The scepter knew she was gaining weight but also seemed to find it curious on how she actually was getting plumper. Menace was undead, so the natural effects of overeating shouldn't even apply...unless this was a detail the both of them seemed to mistake as false. "You rump is as round as the sun is bright~"

"Well yeah, I know that already..." Menace remarked with a roll of her eyes, recalling how many stares she's drawn in from men of villages she has passed through. Although to be fair, who wouldn't have their attentions averted with an outfit as...revealing as Menace's? The princess saw it was best to effectively tune out her scepter's perverted musings and focus more on what she wanted to do next. More importantly, on what her next move would be from here. There were plenty of areas farther on that she could go to on her way to the Queen's kingdom...but, after her last attempt, she would have to be careful around the people...
1213321.title: Tomb Weighter

12133211.content:
While Menace sat by and thought on where she should head into next (all the while ignoring Setra's persistant pokings at how she was getting chubby), the direct concentration of her mind was broken by the sound of footsteps approaching. Not expecting any visitors, or rather not even wanting any, Menace threw her gaze upward to see a few of her mooks had managed to catch something...a young woman to be exact. "Oh, and what's this?" Setra mused aloud, raising an eyebrow to the newcomer, assuming from the get go that she was of a hostile party. The woman herself was fairly short and husky, having a figure that was noticeable chubby with a large belly and an even larger bosom. She wore an attire that was similar to that of that Tomoe girl Menace had seen once or twice. However, this woman's miko based attire had a far different color scheme being black and dark green as opposed to red and white like the usual miko uniform was. Her hair black and styled similarly to Menace's, only being much longer in that it reached to around her back. Vulpine ears sat perched atop her head, said ears being of the same color as her hair and at her behind were 7 large and bushy fox tails of the same shade of black. It was, in fact, stranger on what this woman truly was than why she was here...but Menace found it was only natural to see what business she had here, regardless of her outward appearance. "I hope you have a good reason for coming in here unannounced...I'm not exactly in the mood for visitors especially unwanted ones."

"A-ah, sorry but, when I heard you were nearby, I thought now was my only chance to present myself to you." The fox woman said, showing her chubby face and a red bandage like sutra talisman wrapped around the left side of her face. "Y-you see, I came here...looking to join you." Well, this was unexpected...Menace rarely got anyone who wanted to join her out of their own free will before. Naturally, it was something that took her by surprise, but it wasn't enough to blind her of her suspicions surrounding this stranger.

"And what leads you to believe I should allow you to join me in my cause?" Menace asked, setting forth to pry as much information out of this fox woman as she could before seeing if she was of use to her. At the moment, she looked far too much like a liability than anything else and that was something Menace didn't need right now...or ever, really. "State your name and what you think would be of use to me and maybe I'll consider letting you tag along."

"Oooh, so mean, my princess. I love how "

"I am Nagayama Kisume, Dark Priestess and the heir to the Nagayama clan. I've heard of the Queen's Blade tournament from my family and other villagers but, I don't think I have alot of combat experience to really play a part in it...however, when I heard of you and your battle against the other tournament participants, I believed that maybe...we could work together toward the prize?" Kisume proposed, Menace remaining silent as she took in the fox's story and ran it through her mind to see if everything actually checked out. So far, the only thing bugging her about this woman was of how she believed whatever she had to offer could help and why it actually applied to Menace of all people.

"Okay, that's all well and good, but what do that doesn't tell me on what you have to offer me." Menace said with a yawn, lazily letting her plump cheek rest in the palm of her hand as she glued her gaze on Kisume and continued onward, "And if you do, why you only came to seek out myself."

"Ah, yes of course...uhm..." Kisume began, "I believe with your power and my knowledge, we can both revive a key benefactor that can help you achieve your goal. Somewhere within these forests is a tomb that has entrapped a powerful beast you can use to topple your opposition and fulfill your goals as you see fit." Hmm, so this is what she had in terms of . Menace wasn't aware of any powerful monsters in this forest, but then again, she didn't know these woods very well to have any idea of what lurked within it's shadows. "It was sealed away long ago, having threatened a large portion of the country with it's immense power. Some have gone to call it a God among Beasts...such is the creature known as Erebos." Ahh, so that's what this monster was...

"And you believe that if we release it, it can help me attain the goal I seek?" Menace asked, the fox girl nodding eagerly in response as she assumed that the princess was leaning towards letting her join forces with her. In truth, Menace wasn't entirely sure if she wanted to believe this or not. Kisume was still a weird case and those usually end up being the ones to stab you in the back later on if you're not careful. This happened to Menace once...it won't happen again. However, this also proved to be a chance for her to finally restore her kingdom to it's former glory what with their being a potential easy switch just laying down around the corner...
12133211.title: The Dark Priestess

choices: This place is a ghost town, let's keep moving inward.
121332111.content:
The idea that there was a being out there that could actually help make earning her kingdom back easier, and perhaps a bit more fun, is what seemed to outweight Menaces usually suspicions about this entire thing. Yeah, she didn't know much about Kisume or if this 'Erebos' she spoke of was actually real or not...the only thing that seemed to come to her mind is the wonderful feeling of controlling such a powerful beast and using it to finally reclaim the kingdom that was stolen from her a thousand years ago. Perhaps, it won't be that bad of an idea to look into what Kisume was gunning for...if things went south, then Menace would just hijack her mind and make the fox girl her slave like she would anyone else. Of course, the vulpine like woman didn't have to know this little tidbit...just the fact that the plump egyptian was going to give her the majesty of letting her join the group. "Hmm, very well. I think I'll look into this 'Erebos' you speak of." Menace spoke up, Kisume's pale face lighting up with delight as her chubby cheeks tinged pink in a bliss induced blush. Menace couldn't help but smile at the initial reaction of the fox girl, finding that if she was this happy to join, then no doubt she'll have little problem with following whatever orders she had. Menace liked obediant servants...they were much more easier to deal with than those who weren't. "Lead the way, I'll follow shortly behind." The princess said, Kisume nodding and head off into the forest, gesturing Menace to follow.

"Oh my, another beautiful maiden...Oooh, this is my lucky day." The perverted scepter cooed, huffing in excitement as Menace ignored his non-existant erection and followed the dark priestess into the underbrush, the mindless servants under her control lumbering along behind their plumped leader.

= Later, Deeper within the Forest... =

A gurgle of hunger echoed from Menace's rounded pot belly, the princess patting her belly to soothe it's impatience as she continued on her journey to locate the resting place of Erebos. Menace had forgotten how long it's been since she had last indulged in that meal she ate back at her little outpost, but her mind was quick to say that it was too far off since then. The princess would make sure to reward her belly's patience once she saw about this Erebos first...until then, she would have to deal with a noisy belly. Setra of course, was one to comment on how her hunger was all but a sign that she was going to get ever so fat from the feast she would undoubtably scarf down after they completed their quest. Menace wanted to shut the scepter up with the logic that she wasn't entirely that hungry but, decided not to feed into his tauntings.

Along the way, Kisume told of Erebos' origins (or something close to them), speaking of how the monster itself used to be worshipped as a form of evil deity of sorts, with the Great Angel being it's counter part and the source of all good for the people who worshipped Erebos. It was only until after the turn of the century and the rise of the Queen, that the evil god began losing faith from his people, as many more seemed intent on unifying under one ruler instead of a god. Fed up with being second bannana, Erebos attacked the capital of Gynos only to be defeated and sealed in the very city that worshipped him. The people who saw him as a god were said to have vanished there after, but it's not entirely certain on where they went exactly. Kisume expressed a deep belief that Erebos would show great interest in helping Menace, claiming that he could very well want 'revenge' for being beaten in Gynos years ago.

There was still the fact of how Kisume seemed to hold so much knowledge regarding Erebos, she merely replied with "A Dark Priestess has to have at least some knowledge on evil dieties."

Soon enough, the odd duo finally managed to reach the final resting place of Erebus, both Menace and Kisume having arrived to the entrance of some ancient ruins, a towering structure located within the very heart of this olden city. The city was nearly overtaken by the natural flora of the forest, what would have been a stoney color of grey, now practically drenched in a sea of organic green as trees and vines grew in and around the forsaken ruins. "Finally, we're here." said Kisume, directing Menace's attention to the large temple located at the heart of the ruins themself. "Erebos should be within that structure there...at least, that's where the legend says he is."

Menace however, took a moment to take in the scenery remembering how Kisume told her that the people of these ruins could have easily stayed behind (even though it was unlikely). Still it paid to be alert when entering ancient ruins...one never knew what sort of ambush there lay and wait within these crumbling old relics...
121332111.title: God of Darkness

choices: Erebos is summon-Oh god what is that thing!?
A small bunny like humanoid pops out of the magic circle. Wut?
1213321111.content:
The unlikely duo had entered the derelict ruins of the forsaken ancient city, the large stone walls adorned with glyphs of an ancient arcane language and code that few beyond it's origin could decipher. Menace often likened them to the hieroglyphs she knew so well in her own kingdom but, these were something entirely different from what she knew. Speaking of these ruins, Menace also kept herself alert for anything living (or undead) lurking somewhere within this maze of stone and wood, but...to her surprise, there didn't appear to be anything shambling through this lost city. No deranged cultists, ancient golems or lost explorer with horrible navigation and luck. It was just as it all had appeared; abandoned.

"Seems this place is as bare as the legend says. A shame, I was hoping to see what it's women looked like..." Setra observed, with a dejected sigh as his handler also took note of the vacancy of the ruins. Though, this was fortunate seeing as she was really in no mood to deal with overzealous members of a fallen civilization any time soon.

"That's a good thing, the last thing I want is to fight anything at the moment." Menace stated with a sigh, wondering just what this Erebos would look like and if this all really was worth the trouble. Sure, she'd do anything to revive her own fallen kingdom, but...

"Ahh, are you feeling lethargic, princess?" Setra asked, his voice seeming to show concern for a moment, but it was soon clear as to why he even brought up such a question. "They say that's the first sign of gaining weight."

Menace responded as she did with all his other teasings, with silence. At least, towards him, anyway. "Are you certain this Erebos will be able to help in my goals?" She uses her silent treatment towards Setra to pull forth more information out of Kisume. Even though the idea of someone being able to actually help her revive her kingdom was wonderful...Menace couldn't help but find this all too good to be true at times. Not that anyone could blame her...

"Absolutely, my research on Erebos has shown me that he's willing to help anyone involved in darkness. Since you're well versed in necromancy, a dark art, Erebos will " Kisume nodded with a smile, her cheerfulness seeming to be derived from finding ways to praise Erebos in some way, shape or form. "Summoning him will give us both powers of an unimaginable magnitude, yours will most certainly be enough to revive your kingdom."

"And you?"

"Zah?"

"What are you going to do with your share of power?" Menace asked again, this time being a bit more specific with her question. Kisume was still an enigma to her and knowing of the kitsune's goals will be a good chance for Menace to see what she's really up to. "You were willing to go to great lengths to summon Erebos, so surely you must have a reason for doing so."

Kisume blinked, her head tilted to one side as she appeared to be pondering on an answer. The two walked in silence, the kitsune showing both Menace and Setra that she...wasn't going to be answering anytime soon. "...You don't have a reason, do you?" Menace said with a flat gaze.

"Uhm...well, aside from just seeing Erebos in person and devoting myself to him as a priestess..." Kisume said with a nervous chuckle. Menace could really only think of one word for this...

"Sheesh, what a fanatic." She shrugged, her face pulled down in a bit as she felt something rather unsavory ride up behind her. The undead princess, used her only free hand reach behind her and pry the seat of her striped bikini bottom from the wedge in betwixt her swollen and jiggling posterior. This was perhaps the first time Menace had ever had her bikini bottom wedgie itself into her bottom before. Sure she had a rather...desirable derriere, but it never mocked eating her own bikini bottom though. "Ugh, such a troublesome thing..." Menace huffed, plump lips pulled down in a sort of pout as Kisume gave the undead egyptian an odd look or two.

Surprisingly, Setra didn't seem to poke fun at Menace's predicament with her large butt and it's need to wedgie her. Instead his attention was on the great temple up ahead, a grand set of stairs pointing upwards to the only door to the supposed resting place of the dark god. "This must be where Erebos is entombed." The talking scepter remarked, Menace pausing and looking up to the large temple sitting before her. The princess took a moment to take in it's sights, her senses beginning to pick up on an incredibly dark presence wafting from within the ancient structure ahead. No doubt about it...this was where Erebos slept.

"Mmm, I can sense his presence..." Kisume hummed in delight and excitement...perhaps even in a lewd moan as she placed her hands on her cheeks, her fluffy vulpine tails wagging slowly.

"Try to keep your robe on until after we summon Erebos." Menace said with a roll of her eyes as she made her way up the stairs and into the temple.

--

The journey to the center of the temple didn't seem to take long and before any of them knew it, they were within an odd chamber marked with various ancient runes and paintings of magic circles adorning the floor and ceiling. Both Menace and Kisume confirmed that this was where the dark god was sealed and had already set to work on bringing him back into the mortal realm. Kisume told of how the both of them had a separate job needed to fully summon Erebos, Kisume needing to connect with Erebos and Menace using necromancy to bring him back up via the connection. With their tasks in place, the summoning ritual began...

Kisume began her chant to the dark god, eyes closed in concentration as she tried to reach out to the slumbering deity below her. The dark kitsune had to wrestle through dozens of curses and dark spirits before her astral hands could reach Erebos buried deep in a grave of hexes and malicious spirits. The weaving hands of Kisume's spirit managed to interlocked with Erebos, just from touching him in spirit was she able to feel how powerful he was...

However, now that she had him, the next phase can begin.

As dark purple sparks rose from the glowing magic circle below, Menace began to pour her magical power into Erebos, using the same dead rising powers as she demonstrated to pull Erebos out. "Such dark power..." Menace thought, as she too was treated to the magnitude of Erebos' malignant aura up close and personal. The chamber began to rumble ominously as the magic circle pulsated and glowed bright purple, the entrance of Erebos being nigh...

12133211112.content:
And the circle erupted with a purple flash, blinding both Menace and Kisume for a moment.

“Hey, what happened?” Asked Menace as she rubbed her eyes.

“Beats me, I got blinded too!” Said Setra. Menace turned her head towards her talking scepter and bore a deadpan expression.

“Objects get blinded…”

“I’m a living being too you know!” Setra turned his head away. “Just inanimate is all.”

“You have no eyes.”

“Yes I do!”

“No eyeballs to be blinded…”

“Well I-“ Setra stopped, as they heard Kisume coughing, must have taken in some of the smoke, as Menace’s eyes reopened a little. “I can sense him…” He muttered…

“Master?” Said Kisume, through Menace’s blurry eyesight her form was wandering aimlessly using her arms like flails. “Master Erebos! Are you there?”

As Menace rubbed her eyes more, her eyesight slowly returned. She readjusted it at the center of the magic circle, where she saw nothing but a mass of purple smoke swirling on the floor…

Then it began to spin a little, like caught by the wind, then slowly creeped towards the center and began to get bigger and bigger, like a tornado.

“Yes! Master! I am here! Your humble servant is here!” Pleaded Kisume, sounding absolutely estatic. Menace focused on the rising tornado, awed at it’s power…

Then it stopped, slumping to the floor and the smoke disappeared. Kisume dropped to her knees and bowed deeply, while Menace had her eyes on the smoke…

And she saw two black prongs of…something from the smoke. It flexed a little bit, yet it made her eyes quirk.

“You seeing this?” She said to Setra.

“Oh yeah. Totally.”

Finally the smoke disappeared all of a sudden, and now Menace’s eyes widened and her mouth dropped.

Those two black prongs earlier…were actually ears…

Bunny ears.

The ‘thing’ in the circle stretched it’s arms and yawned and Menace rubbed her eyes with both hands believing the earlier flash of light maybe causing her hallucinations, or maybe the smoke had some poison or an odorless poison to it. She stopped rubbing and blinked.

There yawning was a young boy who looked no older than thirteen. His skin was tanned, much like her own only a bit more brown and he had a similar shade of black hair as hers. His height seemed to stop around her bust, and his physique was slim borderline effeminate. And his long black hair covered where humans had their ears, and on top of his head were the black bunny ears from which she saw. As he stopped yawning a blinked a few times, she noticed his eye color was an ice blue, haunting yet beautiful. His choice of clothing was that of a sleeveless black robe with shorts that stopped above his knees and around the trimming and edges of the article of clothing were glowing red runes.

As he rubbed his eyes, Menace felt something bubble up inside her as she stared at the bowing and revering Kisume.

Anger…

“Kisume!” She barked. She got the fox girl’s attention as she whipped her head around in confusion. “is this some sort of joke!” She yelled with narrowed eyes. To think she went through all that walking in the jungle to see some sort ruse of a ritual spell to summon some…bunny boy. She has wasted her time and filled with her false hope.

Perhaps retaining her mind and throwing her to some hungry greedy old men in some run down village will be a more suitable punishment for fooling her rather than living as a slave and-

“Uh, Menace?” Said Setra speaking. Menace turned and glared at the scepter. “I can sense a very dark magical aura form him.”

“That’s right Menace!” Said Kisume with a grin. “The air is rank with his malignant magical aura so-“ She turned and saw the bunny boy. “What.”

The bunny boy stood there unmoving, blinking and taking in the environment. He walked up to Kisume with a neutral face.

“Are you the one who has broke my seal, woman?” Asked the boy in a haughty tone. Menace’s mouth would had dropped to the floor were it not for muscle, skin, and cartilage keeping it together.

“No. Friggin. Way,” said Menace.

“Yes Lord Erebos,” said Kisume with an estatic grin and relieved face. “Oh how I longed to see you my master, free from your wretched seal…”

The boy, or Erebos now, grinned confidently. “I see then, you’re faithfulness will be rewarded, now rise…” He paused, twirling his hand around and bearing a face of anxiousness.

“Oh my! Kisume! Nagayama Kisume!” She rose to her feet, her head just a tad bit taller than he, to which he quirked an eyebrow.

“You’re rather tall for a fox-woman. What has gone on here?” He demanded, then he laid eyes on Menace. And he calmly walked up to her, and as he approached, he craned his neck a little to see the taller egpytian corpse princess.

“Has the world’s population grown taller since I have been sealed? Why am I not twenty feet with several dozen tentacles with dark energies over my person?” He snipped.

“Look in your reflection, bub,” said Menace pointing down to the puddle at her left. Erebos turned his head…

121332111121.content:
A lot of time had passed since Erebos had been sealed away. During this time, also had another lasting effect on his physical body; by spending so much time sealed off from the outside world. The dark god lost his physical form in an odd variation of decay and a lasting curse placed on his seal as a final move to screw him over. To put it simply, the long time he had spent slumbering in the darkness, combined with that of the curse, caused his body to lose it's original shape and take on a more compact and simpler form to accomodate for the loss of bodily mass he suffered. Did this mean that Erebos expected any of this?

"Ahhhh, what the hell is this farce!?"

Nope.

The bunny boy could hardly believe his eyes, the eldritch and damning form he held long ago...was lost. The form he had so proudly held above all others and used to drown many into madness...was gone. No more. Out to lunch.

"My precious body...my beautiful hideous body..." Erebos muttered as he clenched his quivering fists in a rising sense of distress.

"Huuh? You mean...you didn't always look like this?" Kisume questioned, her bewilderment about the dark god's current shape and form seeming to leave her as the borderline obssessive diligence she held towards him showed that she found absolutely nothing wrong with her god's new body. In all honesty, Kisume found him rather adorable in this form. "But you look so cute~"

"S-silence, wench! A dark god should not be 'cute', he should be malevolent and foreboding!" Erebos snapped, whirling away from the accursed puddle that gave him the misfortune of gazing upon what he truly looked like. "Damn...someone must have placed a curse upon my body upon sealing me...no one's going to take a dark god seriously if he looks like...THIS." By this point, Kisume felt it was mandatory to intervene and console her frustrated deity the best way she could...

"No need to worry Master Erebos, your servant is here to help you feel better!" The kitsune said, opening her arms to the small god, revealing her heaving cleavage and impressive bosom. Erebos gave the kitsune an apprehensive look before he found himself pulled into the fleshy valley of breast fat, Kisume cuddling her god in an attempt to placate him and maybe calm him down. Instead, Kisume's actions only seemed to evoke Erebos to scream in protest in hopes of being let go from the suffocating death hug. "That's it, Master Erebos...cry all your frustrations into my bosom..."

Naturally, she didn't even know he was protesting...

"...He certainly is the ill-fated deity, isn't he?" Setra remarked to Menace, the egyptian princess pursing her lips as she attempted to make sense out of this silly situation. So far, Erebos' appearance was the only let down about him...his other qualities seemed to still hold true, most notably, his immense dark power which Menace could still feel radiating from his body and practically enriching her own. Maybe all hope was not lost here and, after all,

"Maybe, but he's still as powerful as Kisume said." Menace answered, holding up a finger to her face as it sparked with a plume of dark, spiritual fire. The swelling of power deep within her also being noted of, after Erebos' awakening. "We can still use his help in our goals and just as Kisume said...

"Do you think he would agree to helping us?" Setra asked, turning his 'head' back to Kisume and the god in question, Erebos now out of the kitsune's cleavage and trying to talk her down from putting him back into it. "He doesn't exactly seem like the type to simply do as one says...unless, you plan on using that ripened figure of yours~" Once again, Setra is quick to point out Menace's strange weight issue...

"Don't worry, I'll figure something out." Menace said to her trusty weapon/companion as she walked toward Erebos to grab his attention. Menace could easily get Erebos to help her revive the kingdom by promising him that he could be it's chief god. On the other hand, helping Erebos get his body back could net her something in the near future...

Her kingdom comes first. She will need to give the god a reason for helping her in the first place.

“Got any ideas?” Asked Setra.

“I got one,” replied Menace as she walked up to the now frightened god, who seemed to be intimidated by Kisume’s cleavage.

“Back I say! If I go back onto that canyon I’ll lose my breath for sure!” Kisume seemed to brighten up considerably.

“Your breath is taken away when you gaze at my breasts my lord!?” Squeeled Kisume, her hands going to her mammaries and groping them and making them jiggle a little. “Oh you’re so compassionate my lord!” She reached forward to hug her, and Erebos had to side step her flying hug.

“You changed the whole meaning of that sentence! You zealous priestess!” He snapped out of anger and fear.

“Oh now you’re being too modest Lord Erebos~,” cooed Kisume as she stood back up and began to chase after Erebos in circles.

“I command you to stop! If you worship me so then you’ll obey what I say!”

“But I wuv you sooo mwuucch~ and you said you wubbed my bwoobies~.”

“Eeeeee!”

Menace stood there with a deadpan look on her face as she watched the almost cartoonish fiasco occur in front of her. Setra was snickering by her side. She gave a slight cough to garner the two’s attention, to which they stopped.

“Pardon me, Lord Erebos right?” Asked Menace with a touch of grace and showing no sign of fangirlism. Erebos relaxed as the taller tanned woman approached him.

“Obviously,” he replied with haughtiness, the fear he had for the chubby fox priestess all but evaporated to sate his ego. “What is it? I can sense you are an undead and have quite a well of dark magic within your person.”

“I am,” Menace bowed to show her respect. “My name is Menace and I am the Queen of the now fallen Amara Kingdom. And my lord,” she went to her knees, her breasts and slight belly jiggling as a result. “I ask you for your help.”

Erebos looked with interest. “Well…why should I give you help? I am the Dark God Erebo. King of the Phantasmal Beasts of the Ninth Plane, Lord of Darkness Ascended, Ruler of the Forbidden Realms. I am not exactly into charity mind you.”

“If I were to make you the chief deity of the Amara Kingdom, would you help me revive it?” The offer made Erebos quirk his eyes and put a hand to his chin in thought.

“Hmmm…” He started to pace a little bit, and his little bunny ears began to swish back and forth, as if an indicator that his thinking cap was being loaded.

And somewhere deep down Menace would have squeelled at the ears moving, but she kept her neutral composure.

Kisume was anything but, her hands to her pink cheeks as she sighed and shuffled her toes in fangirl-ish glee and the overall cute-ness of the weakened dark god.

Erebos paced back in forth, and then turned towards the Egyptian undead queen.

“So I will be worshipped then. I would have a religion centered around me, if I choose to help you revive the Amara. Correct?”

“Precisely.” Erebos closed his eyes and thought for a moment.

“Very well then,” Erebos turned to towards the dark skinned woman, nodding. “I will assist you in reviving your kingdom to it’s former splendor Queen Menace.”

Menace smiled with glee. Her kingdom will be restored! She no longer has to remain in control of that accursed Swamp Witch. Maybe she could even break free from the women’s control thanks to Erebos’ power! She bowed respectfully and to her knees.

“I am most honored and I thank you Lord Erebos for your generosity,” she said. “Your religion will eclipse those created by all others, I can assure you.”

“And I will be your First Disciple!” Chirped Kisume as she glomped Erebos from behind. The shota-god stammered.

“H-H-Hey! Don’t g-g-go initating stuff on your own like that!”

“But I know all about you and studied you and stayed up all nights and read about you and-“

Menace drowned out the endless rambling from the foxgirl, she could care less to be honest. Right now she can finally revive the kingdom she loved back to it’s former glory.

“Well my lord,” Menace offered her hand to the smaller tanned boy. “Shall we be off? Kingdoms don’t come back over night you know.”

Erebos took her hand, if only to escape from Kisume’s glomping. “Yes, lets.”

And the trio walked out, Kisume going on and on on how her dream as come true, Erebus sticking close as possible to Menace as possible, and Menace still in a eurphoric state of happiness.

They didn’t notice that by being around Erebos during the summoning, their stomachs got a tee bit more taught, as if stuffed with food, but the girls showed no signs of holding a food baby at all.

A certain scepter did on the other hand, but stayed quiet and just made simple conversation as they left the temple…

12133211112111.content:
In the beginning of this strange partnership, Menace was skeptical of how everything would play out. At first, she believed Kisume to be merely that was out to pull the wool over her eyes and make off with the effeminate dark god...but, even if Kisume was a roving fanatic of the deity of darkness she was still willing to share his power with her. Something Menace was also wary of but, she would make sure to keep a close eye on Kisume as they traveled. These suspicions aside, Menace was more than a little delighted and excited with the current situation, her goal to revive her kingdom just within her grasp. With Erebos' (and Kisume's) support, she will finally re-attain her status as Queen of the Amara Kingdom. Menace didn't want to get too far ahead of herself but, she just couldn't help it...especially with how close she was to achieving her life long goal.

As of currently however, the trio were traveling from their previous destination and were now entering the jungles adjacent to the large and ruined city they had summoned Erebos from. Menace wasn't entirely familiar with these tropical areas, but Erebos seemed to at least know of a desert just over a ridge of mountains near the tropical wilderness they were currently trekking through. Menace didn't want to automatically assume this was where her kingdom was, but it couldn't hurt to give it a try. Of course, the trio still had to make their way through this dense jungle and over said mountain ridge before they could reach the desert.

Even though Menace was not subjected to fall prey to fatigue, this did not seem to stop her body from making the trek tedious; her soft body seeming to have puffed up a small amount, as her curvacious hips and thighs had swelled and that bountiful bottom blossomed out even further. One could easily be hypnotized by the swaying and jiggling of Menace's tubby backside, her rounded and well-padded hips working in tandem to create such a wonderous ass to marvel upon. Menace's gut and chest were a bit less pronounced than her bottom area, but they too were not without expansion. Menace's breasts had gone up another cup size, further pressing the plate on her quivering bosom skyward while her belly lay slightly pudged and rounded out with a squishy layer of body fat.

Kisume had also seemed to have been subjected to the same form of puffiness in physique, the already chubby fox girl now having swelled up in body a teensy amount. Her form fitting kimono hugged tightly around her plump body, her large, bouncing bosom pushing the front of her oriental robe apart and gradually exposing the valley of Kisume's copious cleavage. Kisume's gut was also pushing out forward, the sash around her middle seeming to bind it down with it's tight hold on her waistline but, one could be assured that Kisume's belly . Below, the kitsune's hips and lower extremities flared out a small amount, though her chubby rear was largely concealed by her set of equally fluffy fox tails. As clingy as she was to Erebos, her plush like frame would have still made the experience delightful.

"And that, my loyal followers, is how I became God of that ancient city." Erebos concluded, his tale of his origins being told to both Menace and Kisume whether they wanted to hear it or not. Kisume, naturally, was more than a little intrigued and amazed at Erebos' life story. Menace found some interest in the dark god's life story, but ultimately wasn't drooling over it's context like Kisume was. According to Erebos, he was an absolute being of dark forces that existed far beneath the world's crust until after he emerged in the ancient city the three of them left from sometime ago. Erebos' memory on who first summoned him was fuzzy but, he did at least remember that it was from someone of high power or status within the city itself. The rest of the story he went on to share were things both Menace and Kisume already knew but...the dark god continued on anyway, intent on concluding his tale as he intended regardless of if they knew the ending or not.

Even so, one factor still bothered Menace...

"Hey, Erebos. I have a question." Menace began, Erebos giving the dead princess his attention.

"Very well, you may speak of your inquiry, Queen Menace." As pretentious as he sounded, he at least had manners every now and then.

121332111121111.content:
Menace's question brought silence to both Erebos and Kisume, the former looking to the desert princess as if she had committed one of the most gravest of sins. The lack of words from Erebos, however, is what seemed to worry Menace a little. Sure, she normally wouldn't be deterred by this, but when he was essential to the revival of her kingdom then...it kinda paid not to piss him off.

"Hmm, I did neglect to go over my former nemesis...but, that's because I hate her guts." Erebos seethed just from the memory of his enemy. So much so, that the fluff on his rabbit ears frizzed and stood up on end as they hung low with irritation. "Bah, just thinking about her just burns my biscuits...!"

"D-don't worry, Lord Erebos! We'll get revenge on her!" Kisume quipped in, attempting to placate the irritable bunny child. Though apart of her had to resist picking him up and snuggling him into her bosom...his little pouty face was just so adorable but, it seemed her sudden thirst for vengeance against the one who wronged Erebos outweighed her fangirlism. "Anyone who dares to displease Lord Erebos should be plunged into the bottomless pits of Abbadon!"

"Hoho, she's certainly has a passionate fire about her." Setra remarked, "It's almost as hot as her bosom is round~"

"We still need to know who it was that sealed Erebos before we even jump to exact judgement." Menace said, looking down to Erebos as she awaited to hear his answer. She was actually very curious as to who it was that Erebos hated so much...not only that, who was actually powerful enough to seal him.

Erebos took in a deep, calming breath as he finally set to reveal the individual he had the most gripes with. "When I attacked the capital, the Queen of Gynos stepped up with her army to oppose me, however, it wasn't her who sealed me away. I don't recall her name but, I know she was something they referred to as a Musha-Miko."

Menace perked as the words 'Musha-Miko' passed through her ears. She knows someone with that title...someone she met long ago in the desert region when she kidnapped one Leina Vance. "It may not be the same Musha-Miko or what have you but, I have heard of a woman who uses that title now."

"Ah, you mean Tomoe the Warrior Priestess?" Kisume spoke up, also seeming to recall some memory of a certain Musha-Miko.

"Yeah, that's the one" Menace nodded.

"Ooh, this is very interesting..." Erebos chuckled evilly, hands rubbing together as thoughts of revenge flooded into his mind. "We'll need to make sure we find and locate this Tomoe sometime...I have a century old score to settle with her ancestor." As the dark god plotted and schemed, his analytical mind was soon shaken by a low grumbling noise that muttered out somewhere near him. Erebos' rabbit like ears perked up in surprise as he looked about and followed it's source to...Menace. More specifically, her gurgling paunch.

"...I've forgotten that I haven't had anything to eat." Menace sighed in exasperation, hand rubbing and pressing into her soft, pot belly. Even so, Menace's touch and gentle massage did little to calm her belly and only served to agitate the empty gut even more.

"I'm somewhat hungry too..." Kisume agreed with Menace, her own ponchy middle echoing with it's dis pleasures of being...well, not full. "Lord Erebos...please save us from this famine..."

"...It's not exactly a famine, y'know..." Menace said with a flat gaze at the exaggerating kitsune.

Erebos looked between the two hungering girls, somewhat unsure of what to even give them...that is, until his nose picked up a rather inviting scent. "Hmph, Fear not, for I know exactly where you shall indulge yourselves." The rabbit god said with an arrogant smile as he ran up past the duo and gestured them to follow behind.

===

Not one to pass up the chance of finally relieving themselves of their growing hunger pangs, Menace and Kisume followed behind the lapine deity through the tropical underbrush. All the while their minds were only churning forth the thoughts of what manner of feast Erebos was leading them too...and not the slowly changing environment as the delved deeper and deeper into the tropical wildlands. As Menace and Kisume continued following Erebos, the vegetation of the lush jungle began to give off a blood red color as the soil seemed to color itself purple or violet.

Eventually, the journey came to a stop as the duo were just catching up to the fleeting god of darkness.

"Please tell me we're already there..." Menace spoke up, her rumbling stomach at the end of it's rope in terms of waiting.

"A little out of shape, eh, Princess~?"

Menace only responded with a glare to Setra as she took a moment to realize where she was...and what it all looked like. "What...where are we...?" And then came the immense surge of dark energy hanging in the atmosphere of this alien new world...or, at least, alien region of the new world. "And what's this dark power in the air...?"

"Y-yeah...I feel it too..." Kisume huffed, trying to catch her breath after so much running. "Though, it feels like it belongs...to Lord Erebos."

"That's because it does, Kisume." Erebos nodded proudly. "This section of the jungle was corrupted by me long ago after I demonstrated my power to those in the ancient city. I hit it so hard with corruption that it's still infested with it centuries later~!" As impressive as this feat was, it had little to do with Menace or Kisume stuffing their faces...something the former took note of quickly.

"That's all well and good, but what does this have to do with us eating?"

"A lot of things, when you consider that my corruption makes things like this possible." Erebos said with a smirk, leading Menace and Kisume past tentacle like bushes and revealed to them a forest of fruit bearing plants. The plants were just as eldritch looking as the forest, but all looking to be overloaded with huge and ripened fruit just begging to be taken. "My darkness corrupted these plants and mutated them into the things they are now. Though, you might want to hurry and eat now."

"Huh, why?" Kisume tilted her head.

"Well..." Almost on cue, one of the trees dropped a large, blue apple like fruit that was roughly the size of Menace's head. As soon as the discolored fruit hit the ground, it sprouted legs and run off into the underbrush. Menace and Kisume stared at the bush the fleeing apple just staring at the bushes before looking back to Erebos.

"Well, if you want to indulge your hunger this is the best there is...unless we find a town."

Menace and Kisume weighed their options, Menace looking down to her rumbling middle as it's demands for food had grown violently loud. This could perhaps be the biggest feast she's ever had...but, something about those fruits didn't sit well with her...
